tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am happy
You are good
He is French
We are friends
You are students
They are here

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for descriptions, states of being, and background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was tired
You were young
She was beautiful
We were happy
You were there
They were friends

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'demain' (tomorrow) or 'la semaine prochaine' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will be at home
You will be good
She will be happy
We will be here
You will be ready
They will be friends

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have been to Paris
You have been good
She has been kind
We have been happy
You have been there
They have been friends

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary French to narrate completed past events. Common in written literature, historical texts, and formal storytelling, but rarely used in everyday speech.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je fus étonné quand je vis le résultat
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was astonished when I saw the result

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu fus le premier à arriver à la réunion importante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were the first to arrive at the important meeting

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle fut une grande artiste pendant toute sa vie
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She was a great artist throughout her life

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous fûmes témoins d'un événement historique
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were witnesses to a historical event

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous fûtes très courageux pendant la guerre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were very brave during the war

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils furent les meilleurs amis jusqu'à la fin
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were the best friends until the end

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Essential for establishing the sequence of past events and often used with 'avant' or 'après'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'avais été malade avant de partir en voyage
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had been sick before leaving on the trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu avais été très nerveux avant l'examen final
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been very nervous before the final exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle avait été professeur pendant vingt ans avant de prendre sa retraite
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had been a teacher for twenty years before retiring

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous avions été au musée avant d'aller au restaurant
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had been to the museum before going to the restaurant

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous aviez été prévenus du danger qui nous attendait
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been warned about the danger that awaited us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils avaient été de bons amis jusqu'à cette dispute
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had been good friends until that argument

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action or before a specific time in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'quand' or 'dès que'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurai été partout dans le monde quand j'aurai cinquante ans
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have been everywhere in the world when I'm fifty

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu auras certainement été fatigué après ce long voyage
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will certainly have been tired after this long journey

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle aura été mariée pendant vingt ans l'année prochaine
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will have been married for twenty years next year

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous aurons été là-bas avant que tu arrives
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have been there before you arrive

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous aurez été prévenus des conséquences avant de prendre votre décision
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have been warned of the consequences before making your decision

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils auront été en réunion toute la journée quand nous arriverons
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have been in a meeting all day when we arrive

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would be happy
You would be good
She would be kind
We would be here
You would be ready
They would be friends

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used to describe what would have happened under different circumstances.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurais été plus heureux si tu étais venu avec moi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have been happier if you had come with me

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu aurais été fier de voir son succès
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have been proud to see his success

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle aurait été une excellente directrice si elle avait accepté le poste
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She would have been an excellent director if she had accepted the position

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous aurions été là-bas plus tôt si le train n'avait pas eu de retard
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would have been there earlier if the train hadn't been delayed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous auriez été surpris de voir les changements
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have been surprised to see the changes

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils auraient été de meilleurs amis s'ils s'étaient mieux compris
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would have been better friends if they had understood each other better

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Common triggers include 'il faut que' (it's necessary that) and 'je veux que' (I want that).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que je sois heureux
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I need to be happy

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que tu sois bon
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You need to be good
She needs to be kind

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous soyons ici
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We need to be here

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous soyez prêts
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You need to be ready
They need to be friends

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, vous) and first person plural (nous). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be good!
Let's be happy!
Be kind!

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but when the main clause is in a past tense. Rarely used in modern spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que je fusse présent à la réunion
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It was necessary that I be present at the meeting

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il voulait que tu fusses plus patient
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He wanted you to be more patient

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bien qu'elle fût malade, elle vint travailler
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Although she was sick, she came to work

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il était important que nous fussions à l'heure
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It was important that we be on time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je craignais que vous fussiez perdus
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I feared that you were lost

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il demanda qu'ils fussent traités avec respect
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He asked that they be treated with respect

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past. Formed with the present subjunctive of the auxiliary verb plus the past participle.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je suis content que j'aie été accepté dans cette université
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'm happy that I was accepted into this university

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il est surprenant que tu aies été choisi pour ce rôle
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's surprising that you were chosen for this role

conjugations.exampleSentence: C'est dommage qu'elle ait été absente hier
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's a pity that she was absent yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bien que nous ayons été en retard, ils nous ont attendus
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Although we were late, they waited for us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je doute que vous ayez été complètement honnêtes
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I doubt that you were completely honest

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il est possible qu'ils aient été mal informés
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's possible that they were misinformed

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Typically follows time expressions like 'quand', 'lorsque', 'après que', 'dès que'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que j'eus été informé, je partis immédiatement
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had been informed, I left immediately

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quand tu eus été présenté à tous, la réunion commença
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When you had been introduced to everyone, the meeting began

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lorsqu'elle eut été élue présidente, elle prononça un discours
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When she had been elected president, she gave a speech

conjugations.exampleSentence: Après que nous eûmes été accueillis, on nous servit le dîner
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After we had been welcomed, dinner was served to us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que vous eûtes été installés, le spectacle débuta
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had been seated, the show began

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quand ils eurent été réunis, le chef prit la parole
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When they had been gathered, the chief spoke

tenses.description: Used primarily in literary French and formal writing to narrate completed actions in the past. Rarely used in spoken French but essential for reading literature and formal documents.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je fus surpris par cette nouvelle
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was surprised by this news

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu fus le premier à arriver
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were the first to arrive

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle fut élue présidente de l'association
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She was elected president of the association

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous fûmes très impressionnés par sa performance
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were very impressed by his performance

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous fûtes choisis pour représenter l'équipe
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were chosen to represent the team

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils furent reçus avec beaucoup d'honneur
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were received with great honor

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have a book
You are hungry
She has a cat
We have time
You are right
They have a house

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for descriptions, states of being, and background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was hungry
You were right
She had a dog
We had time
You were afraid
They had a car

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'demain' (tomorrow) or 'la semaine prochaine' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have time
You will succeed
She will have a child
We will be lucky
You will be right
They will have a party

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have been lucky
You have been right
She has had a child
We have had time
You have been afraid
They have had a party

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary French to narrate completed past events. Common in written literature, historical texts, and formal storytelling, but rarely used in everyday speech.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'eus une révélation soudaine en lisant ce livre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had a sudden revelation while reading this book

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eus beaucoup de difficultés pendant cette période
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had many difficulties during this period

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle eut trois enfants au cours de sa vie
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had three children during her life

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous eûmes la chance de rencontrer des gens extraordinaires
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had the chance to meet extraordinary people

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous eûtes le courage de dire la vérité
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had the courage to tell the truth

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils eurent beaucoup de succès dans leurs entreprises
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had a lot of success in their ventures

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Essential for establishing the sequence of past events and often used with 'avant' or 'après'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'avais eu des doutes avant de prendre ma décision
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had had doubts before making my decision

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu avais eu raison de te méfier de lui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been right to be wary of him

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle avait eu beaucoup de problèmes avant de trouver cette solution
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had had many problems before finding this solution

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous avions eu le temps de tout préparer avant leur arrivée
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had had time to prepare everything before their arrival

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous aviez eu l'occasion de voyager beaucoup dans votre jeunesse
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had had the opportunity to travel a lot in your youth

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils avaient eu une grande fête avant de déménager
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had had a big party before moving

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action or before a specific time in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'quand' or 'dès que'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurai eu le temps de finir avant ton retour
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have had time to finish before you return

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu auras certainement eu des nouvelles d'ici là
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will certainly have had news by then

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle aura eu cinquante ans le mois prochain
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will have been fifty years old next month

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous aurons eu assez de temps pour tout vérifier
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have had enough time to check everything

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous aurez eu l'occasion de réfléchir avant de répondre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have had the opportunity to think before answering

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils auront eu plusieurs avertissements avant d'être sanctionnés
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have had several warnings before being sanctioned

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have time
You would be right
She would have a child
We would be lucky
You would be afraid
They would have a party

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used to describe what would have happened under different circumstances.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurais eu plus de temps si j'avais commencé plus tôt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have had more time if I had started earlier

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu aurais eu raison de refuser cette offre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have been right to refuse this offer

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle aurait eu une meilleure vie si elle avait fait d'autres choix
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She would have had a better life if she had made other choices

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous aurions eu moins de problèmes si nous avions été mieux préparés
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would have had fewer problems if we had been better prepared

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous auriez eu l'occasion de le rencontrer si vous étiez venus
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have had the opportunity to meet him if you had come

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils auraient eu plus de succès avec une stratégie différente
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would have had more success with a different strategy

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Common triggers include 'il faut que' (it's necessary that) and 'je veux que' (I want that).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que j'aie le temps
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I need to have time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que tu aies raison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You need to be right

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'elle ait de la chance
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She needs to be lucky

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous ayons le temps
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We need to have time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous ayez de la chance
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You need to be lucky

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils aient une fête
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They need to have a party

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, vous) and first person plural (nous). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be patient!
Let's be brave!
Have faith!

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but when the main clause is in a past tense. Rarely used in modern spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il aurait fallu que j'eusse plus de temps pour finir
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It would have been necessary that I had more time to finish

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je souhaitais que tu eusses cette opportunité
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wished that you had this opportunity

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bien qu'il eût beaucoup d'argent, il restait généreux
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Although he had a lot of money, he remained generous

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il voulait que nous eussions confiance en lui
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He wanted us to have confidence in him

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je craignais que vous n'eussiez pas assez de provisions
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I feared that you didn't have enough supplies

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il importait qu'ils eussent toutes les informations nécessaires
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It was important that they had all the necessary information

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past. Formed with the present subjunctive of the auxiliary verb plus the past participle.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je regrette que j'aie eu si peu de patience
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I regret that I had so little patience

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il est dommage que tu aies eu ces difficultés
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's a pity that you had these difficulties

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je suis heureux qu'elle ait eu cette chance
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'm happy that she had this chance

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bien que nous ayons eu des problèmes, nous avons réussi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Although we had problems, we succeeded

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je doute que vous ayez eu le temps de tout préparer
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I doubt that you had time to prepare everything

conjugations.exampleSentence: C'est incroyable qu'ils aient eu autant de succès
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: It's incredible that they had so much success

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Typically follows time expressions like 'quand', 'lorsque', 'après que', 'dès que'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que j'eus eu la confirmation, je les appelai
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had received confirmation, I called them

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quand tu eus eu fini ton travail, tu partis en vacances
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When you had finished your work, you went on vacation

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lorsqu'elle eut eu son diplôme, elle chercha un emploi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When she had gotten her diploma, she looked for a job

conjugations.exampleSentence: Après que nous eûmes eu leur accord, nous commençâmes le projet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After we had gotten their agreement, we started the project

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que vous eûtes eu les résultats, vous nous informâtes
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had gotten the results, you informed us

conjugations.exampleSentence: Quand ils eurent eu toutes les réponses, ils prirent leur décision
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When they had gotten all the answers, they made their decision

tenses.description: Used primarily in literary French and formal writing to narrate completed actions in the past. Rarely used in spoken French but essential for reading literature and formal documents.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'eus l'occasion de visiter Paris l'année dernière
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had the opportunity to visit Paris last year

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eus de la chance de réussir cet examen difficile
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were lucky to pass this difficult exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Elle eut une carrière exceptionnelle dans la médecine
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had an exceptional career in medicine

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous eûmes beaucoup de difficultés au début du projet
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had many difficulties at the beginning of the project

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous eûtes le courage de prendre cette décision importante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had the courage to make this important decision

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils eurent une influence considérable sur l'évolution de la société
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had a considerable influence on the evolution of society

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I go to school
You go home
He goes to the cinema
We go for a walk
You go shopping
They go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was going to school
You were going home
He was going to the cinema
We were going for a walk
You were going shopping
They were going to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'demain' (tomorrow) or 'la semaine prochaine' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will go to school tomorrow
You will go home
He will go to the cinema
We will go for a walk
You will go shopping
They will go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu es allé à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have gone home
He has gone to the cinema
We have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous êtes allés faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have gone shopping
They have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary French to narrate completed past events. Rarely used in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I went to school
You went home
He went to the cinema
We went for a walk
You went shopping
They went to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'étais allé à l'école avant qu'il pleuve
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had gone to school before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu étais allé à la maison avant que je vienne
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone home before I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il était allé au cinéma avant que nous arrivions
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had gone to the cinema before we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous étions allés nous promener avant qu'il fasse nuit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had gone for a walk before it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous étiez allés faire les courses avant la fermeture
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone shopping before closing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils étaient allés au théâtre avant le spectacle
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had gone to the theater before the show

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action. Often used with time expressions like 'd'ici demain' (by tomorrow).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je serai allé à l'école d'ici demain
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have gone to school by tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu seras allé à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have gone home
He will have gone to the cinema
We will have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous serez allés faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have gone shopping
They will have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'irais à l'école si j'avais le temps
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would go to school if I had time
You would go home
He would go to the cinema
We would go for a walk
You would go shopping
They would go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses referring to the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je serais allé à l'école si j'avais pu
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have gone to school if I could have

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu serais allé à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have gone home
He would have gone to the cinema
We would have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous seriez allés faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have gone shopping
They would have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Often used after 'il faut que', 'je veux que', etc.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que j'aille à l'école
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je veux que tu ailles à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'il aille au cinéma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous allions nous promener
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous alliez faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils aillent au théâtre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, nous, vous). The subject pronoun is omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go to school!
Let's go for a walk!
Go shopping!

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but referring to past events. Rarely used in modern spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que j'allasse à l'école
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je voulais que tu allasses à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait qu'il allât au cinéma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had to go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que nous allassions nous promener
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que vous allassiez faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait qu'ils allassent au théâtre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to go to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que je sois allé à l'école
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je veux que tu sois allé à la maison
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'il soit allé au cinéma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous soyons allés nous promener
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous soyez allés faire les courses
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils soient allés au théâtre
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Rarely used in modern French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que je fus allé à l'école, il pleuvit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had gone to school, it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que tu fus allé à la maison, je vins
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had gone home, I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès qu'il fut allé au cinéma, nous arrivâmes
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as he had gone to the cinema, we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que nous fûmes allés nous promener, il fit nuit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as we had gone for a walk, it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que vous fûtes allés faire les courses, la boutique ferma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had gone shopping, the store closed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès qu'ils furent allés au théâtre, le spectacle commença
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as they had gone to the theater, the show began

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I do my homework
You do sports
The weather is nice
We cook
You make a cake
They do their homework

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was doing my homework
You were doing sports
The weather was nice
We were cooking
You were making a cake
They were doing their homework

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'demain' (tomorrow) or 'la semaine prochaine' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will do my homework tomorrow
You will do sports
The weather will be nice
We will cook
You will make a cake
They will do their homework

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have done my homework
You have done sports
The weather has been nice
We have cooked
You have made a cake
They have done their homework

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary French to narrate completed past events. Rarely used in spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I did my homework
You did sports
The weather was nice
We cooked
You made a cake
They did their homework

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'avais fait mes devoirs avant qu'il pleuve
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had done my homework before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu avais fait du sport avant que je vienne
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had done sports before I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il avait fait beau avant qu'il pleuve
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The weather had been nice before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Nous avions fait la cuisine avant qu'il fasse nuit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had cooked before it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vous aviez fait un gâteau avant la fermeture
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had made a cake before closing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ils avaient fait leurs devoirs avant le spectacle
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had done their homework before the show

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action. Often used with time expressions like 'd'ici demain' (by tomorrow).

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurai fait mes devoirs d'ici demain
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have done my homework by tomorrow
You will have done sports
The weather will have been nice
We will have cooked
You will have made a cake
They will have done their homework

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je ferais mes devoirs si j'avais le temps
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would do my homework if I had time
You would do sports
The weather would be nice
We would cook
You would make a cake
They would do their homework

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used with 'si' (if) clauses referring to the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: J'aurais fait mes devoirs si j'avais pu
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have done my homework if I could have
You would have done sports
The weather would have been nice
We would have cooked
You would have made a cake
They would have done their homework

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Often used after 'il faut que', 'je veux que', etc.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que je fasse mes devoirs
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must do my homework

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je veux que tu fasses du sport
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to do sports
The weather must be nice

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous fassions la cuisine
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must cook

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous fassiez un gâteau
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must make a cake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils fassent leurs devoirs
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must do their homework

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, nous, vous). The subject pronoun is omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Do your homework!
Let's cook!
Make a cake!

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but referring to past events. Rarely used in modern spoken French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que je fisse mes devoirs
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to do my homework

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je voulais que tu fisses du sport
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to do sports
The weather had to be nice

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que nous fissions la cuisine
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to cook

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait que vous fissiez un gâteau
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to make a cake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il fallait qu'ils fissent leurs devoirs
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to do their homework

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must have done my homework

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to have done sports

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The weather must have been nice

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must have cooked

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous ayez fait un gâteau
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must have made a cake

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils aient fait leurs devoirs
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must have done their homework

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had done my homework, it rained

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had done sports, I came

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as the weather had been nice, we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as we had cooked, it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had made a cake, the store closed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès qu'ils eurent fait leurs devoirs, le spectacle commença
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as they had done their homework, the show began

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must have known the answer

conjugations.exampleSentence: Je veux que tu aies su chanter
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to have known how to sing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'il ait su nager
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must have known how to swim

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que nous ayons su danser
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must have known how to dance

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut que vous ayez su cuisiner
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must have known how to cook

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il faut qu'ils aient su jouer
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must have known how to play

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary French to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Rarely used in modern French.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que j'eus su la réponse, il pleuvit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had known the answer, it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que tu eus su chanter, je vins
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had known how to sing, I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès qu'il eut su nager, nous arrivâmes
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as he had known how to swim, we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que nous eûmes su danser, il fit nuit
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as we had known how to dance, it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès que vous eûtes su cuisiner, la boutique ferma
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had known how to cook, the store closed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dès qu'ils eurent su jouer, le spectacle commença
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as they had known how to play, the show began
